thread.title: Amateurs Comb Raqqa’s Ruins for Explosives

author: Raja Abdulrahim
title: Amateurs Comb Raqqa’s Ruins for Explosives
text:
RAQQA, Syria—In the clock-tower square rimmed by rubble, people desperate to return to their booby-trapped homes seek out the man with the scruffy beard selling cigarettes and fresh eggs.
He guides them toward a small, ragtag group of de-miners who have no training and few, if any, tools—men like Muhammad al-Shaeeb, a quiet, barely five-foot-tall 18-year-old, who venture into homes in this former Islamic State stronghold where explosives could be lurking under any light switch or towel or inside a refrigerator.
...
